stories.text: Just curious how people contribute to open source projects which you don't really want your personal identity linked to. There's a few projects I'd like to submit contributions to, but I also don't want it to show up to prospective employers in the future. Does anyone use an alias for this kind of thing? And how do you go about setting up git/github/etc. to easily swap identities?
stories.title: Ask HN: Do you use an alias for OSS contributions?
Why Houston is a bold case against zoning
Report on the University’s Role in Political and Social Action (1967) [pdf]

stories.text:
If there is no vaccine for the now dominant BA.5 covid variant, what is going to happen this coming school year?

It seems like a pretty bad plan to stick the kids and teacher all in a room together. Why would teachers even sign up for this?

Low pay, low appreciation, near-guaranteed eventual covid infection.

The school districts in Oakland, CA have a massive number of vacant teaching positions they're becoming increasingly desperate to fill.

Arizona relaxed the requirements to allow anyone to teach as long as they're currently enrolled in college to become a teacher.

It seems crazy.
stories.title: Ask HN: How will things work out this school year without an effective vaccine?
